result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas D Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample; pay the surcharge.

No firearms; weapons.
 Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact. 
-Contact is allowed for court appearances.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas D Chapman not in court.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact. 
-Contact is allowed for court appearances.  
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  The defendant is not feeling well.  Court granted defense request for adjournment.  Counsel informed the Court this matter will resolve and the 11/02/15 jury trial date was vacated.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense would like a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. State is awaiting additional discovery. Court ordered the jury trial date calendared for 9/21/15 vacated and adjourned the case in branch 40. Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for status conference.  Attorney Van Severen could not appear.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Attorney Benjamin Van Severen received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is hiring counsel.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AVA W-C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Thomas D Chapman in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Thomas D Chapman in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge DALLET.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
